text: Bottle at tasting. Muddy brown pour. Aroma of delicious bourbon vanilla, raisin, caramel and booze. Rich taste of luscious bourbon vanilla, buttery caramel fudge, raisin, booze and some malt. This is how a bourbon ba barley wine should be done, fantastic.

Refrigerated 12 oz. 2014 brown bottle from FlandersNed poured into a snifter. Opaque dark brown with very small beige head. Aroma is caramel malt, medium body, medium/low carbonation, and very little lacing. Taste is toffee, caramel, some dark fruit, a little heat, and a little booze.  Malty and quite nice for the ABV.

Pours warm rubyred/caramelly brown. Small white head. Smell is intense, bit booze, dades, warm, complex, caramel. Taste is super intense, sweet, thick, rich fruityness. Dades, raisins. Very complex, leaves, some wood. Very mild bourbon. Hint of bitterness on The end. Silky, sticky mf and low carbo. Extremely nice, as expected.

Thanks Greg for sharing bottle! 2015 bottle poured into a taster showing lightly translucent dark wooden brown with no head. 

The nose light bourbon background with light figs and dates. 

The palate is medium bodied and moderately carbonated with very prickly alcohol. Strong bourbon forwardness with a light sweetness.

Hazy medium brown mahogany color. Amazing bourbon, tootsie roll, vanilla, burnt raisins, dark fruit, figs, chocolate in the nose. Slighy tart. Medium full body, low carbonation, tons of vanilla, burnt raisins and brown sugar. Fairly sweet but alcohol for the strength is well hidden. Smooth as can be. Long lingering bourbon and vanilla finish. Excellent.
12oz 2014 bottle. Caramel clear pour. Aroma is booze, caramel, nutty. Taste follows, boozy, sweet, this crazy good.

Bottle. Aroma of bourbon, dark berry, chocolate fudge, caramel, vanilla icecream. Hazy brown with tan head, not lasting. Taste is light boozy, moderate sweet and light bitter. Full body, oily feel and sweet boozy finish.

Bottle. Pours dark hazy brown with a small light brown head. Aromas of vanilla, fudge, butterscotch, chocolate, malt, black currants, vanilla icecream, light booze. Taste is bready, malty, huge vanilla, fudge, chocolate, butterscotch, dark fruits. Fuckin hell this is good.
Bottle. Medium head with medium duration. Color is dark brown. Aroma and taste are rich fruits, bourbon, wood, caramel, malt, hops and alcohol. Full bodied. Warming boozy finish.

At the Barleywine event. Vintage 2014. Aroma is caramel, bourbon, barrel, hops, toffee, eh. Appearance is amber, light tan head, clear. Taste is booze, barrel, caramel, hops, harsh. Mouthfeel is medium body, light carbonation, booze aftertaste. Overall, not good.

Dark brown in color... Aroma of coconut, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, dark fruits... Flavor is big and boozy, lots of figs, dark fruits, chocolate, coconut, with notes of bourbon heat on palate... lots of chewy vanilla notes, sticky and sweet, alcohol isn't that well concealed... Good BW

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On tap @ Kuhnhenn. Pour is amber/brown with a very small head. Notes of bourbon, oak, molasses, honey, and dark fruit. Finish is similar with more bourbon coming through.
Bottle. Pours a hazy brown. Aroma and taste are bourbon, caramel, toffee, vanilla, and oak.

12 oz bottle from the brewery, dated 2015.  Pours a deep red brown with a yellowish off-white head.  Strong bourbon and raisin fig aroma, molasses.  Flavor has raisin dark fruit, molasses, and bourbon oak with a bit of oxidation.  Really very good.

Even by the strong standards of the Barleywine, Kuhnhenns barrel-aged ale is some unholy beast. At 15% its dangerously potent, but it doesnt drink like a huge beer. Dark brown pour. Butterscotch, toasted malt, molasses, and vanilla aromas. Taste profile consists of dark fruit, caramel, coconut, and malt sugar. Alcohol heat is tucked away under the full-bodied malts. This is one hell of a way to be introduced to Kuhnhenn. Thisll put you right on your ass.

(Thanks, Cory! "BlowOffTube")

Bottle.

A- Coconut, vanilla, cherry, oak, booze.

A- Mahogany color, clear liquid, beige head.

T- Cherry, oak, boozy, coconut, butterscotch.

P- Full body, average texture, average carbonation, complex finish.

O- A little hot and boozy but overall a hell of a lot smoother than one could expect going in. Well balanced and complex. A bit of time on this and its be swell and mellow.

12os bottle 2014 vintage pours clear ruby dark red with half finger fizzy head. Nose and taste have lots of big gooey caramel and sweet raisin, plum, fig and various dark fruit, touches of light vanilla spice, bread, cherry and big malty sweetness. Very good but not quite as good as BB4D.
Massive amounts of caramel, sweet and lightly roasted malts. Sweet vanilla cream and oak blend nicely. Moderate heat front the alcohol but really walk balanced.
F*cking epic barley wine! Has some stout and chocolate notes. Incredibly complex beer. I wanna try this back again :o

12 oz bottle, 2015 edition. intense caramel and hard candy.  Oak vanilla toffee.  Lots of spirit but not boozy. Some heavy and flavorful stuff, tastes every bit of the advertised 15%.  Thick stuff for a barleywine.

Pours a dark brown with a thin white head. Aroma is dark fruits, oak, caramel, toffee, butter, and vanilla. Flavor is very similar, with the oak less pronounced, replaced with a boozy heat. Sweet and thick-bodied. This is terrific.

Où, Quand, Comment :  Bouteille. Mondial de la bière. 


Visuel :  
Couleur : brune ambrée. 
Apparence : claire. 


Arôme :  
Caramel toffee, sucre brun, fruité (léger prunes, raisins) notes dalcool, fût de chêne liquoreux, notes rôties


Goût :  
Entrée de bouche : fruité (raisins, dates figues), boisé (fût de chêne)
Dominance de caramel toffee léger rôti, alcool réchauffant, notes de sirop dérable, notes terreuses et de chocolat


En bouche :  

Corps : Rond.
Effervescence : moyenne-basse.
Texture : sirupeux et liquoreux.
Finale : longue, légèrement amère dalcool et de rôti, fruitée
Caramel and dark fruits and molasses and bourbon and vanilla and this is basically exactly the English BABW youd dream of.

12oz bottle from Kuhnhenn. Pours amber. No head. Aroma is very pleasant caramel corn, brown sugar, molasses and alcohol. Flavor is hot, metallic, caramel and bitter with a very thin body. Bourbon barrel is imperceptible, except in the hot, biting alcohol. It should be noted that this is a 2014 and drinking very young. Overall, hoping this beer improves with age. Will re-rate. Did not finish the bottle between a tasting group of five. BB4D blows this beer out of the water.

Bottle, kindly donated by my Secret Santa, many thanks Clownoisseur. Shared with my daughter. Amber brown color with minimal white head. Honey, sweet malt, bourbon, nuts, wood.Taste, sweet malt, honey, bourbon, raisins, walnuts, coconut, sherry, dates, wood. Strong alcoholic finish. Tasty.

2014 vintage. Pours a deep mahogany. Copper hues. A small tan head that fades to a ring. A bit of leg creeps up the glass. Aromas of roasted malt, wet oak, whiskey and dark fruit. Hot! Taste follows the nose with the barrel character being very prominent. Rich roasted barley, dark fruits and some earthiness carry the body, but ultimately, it is the wet oak bourbon that leaves the final impression. Good stuff, but a bit too barrel-forward at this time.

Bottle. Pours slightly cloudy amber. Aroma is mega butterscotch, bourbon, sweet orange, honey. Taste is butterscotch, bitter orange, fruity coffee, mild roast, cherry, honey. Prickly carbonation. Very sweet.
bottle at Coles Barleywine Contest. Must have been a bad bottle. BAD, undrinkable. will rerate

Bottle: Have had on tap many times, but the bottles always taste better to me. This is a 2010 vintage, labeled at 15.1% ABV & around 3 years old. Solid, slightly red-tinted color with pretty nice clarity. Barely any head, just a small beige collar that outlines the edges. Aroma fills the room as the cap is popped. Sticky caramel & toffee factory laced with undertones of prunes, dates, raisins, maple syrup, mild oak, vanilla, warming bourbon, & a rich brown sugar aspect. So strong, robust, sweet, decadent. Huge body; viscous, chewy, sticky. You could cut this with a knife. Incredible toffee & caramel backdrop; sticky sweet & rich. The bourbon is more forward than the barrel, but plenty of woody vanillin & lightly toasted oak is still present. Dark fruits, dates, prunes, mild anise, maple, there is just so much to enjoy here. Incredible. Amazing. One of my personal favorite barley wines.

Draught at CBC 2014. Clear ruby liquid with a medium off-white head. Aroma of bourbon, wood, raw sugar, toffee and caramel. Taste is light to medium sweet and light to medium bitter with notes of bourbon and wood. Medium bodied with low carbonation. Really good stuff.
Bottle thanks to Matt. Pours a clear copper with no head. The aroma is strong booze, wood, roast. Thin mouthfeel with raisin, booze, candy sugar, sweet finish. Good.
"vanilla, bourbon, oak, sweet light and dark fruit...superb aroma and incredibly smooth for a beer of this strength. my first kuhnhen beer is a doozie!!"

Keg at the Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014, red session. 03/05/2014. Red/ amber coloured oour with a halo of cream head. Aroma is bourbon vanilla, oak. Flavour is Full bodied, unrefined sugars, brown sugar, hot alcohol. Some dired fruits. Palare is full bodied with fine carbonation.
Draught at CBC 2014. Dark brown colour with an off-white head. Aroma and flavour of toastedmalt, caramel, dried fruit, vanilla, oak, bourbon and alcohol.

12 oz bottle from 2013 Winter Solstice coming in at 14.0% ABV. 
Aroma is failry rich and malty with lots of dark caramel and toffee with some lighter roast and medium light chocolate to balance the caramel. Some medium light bourbon notes with some light alcohol spice. Medium light raisins, figs and prunes. Faint hop notes. 
Pours dark brown with some lighter brown and amber hues on the edges. Small, somewhat thin, tan head recedes fairly quickly to the edges where it lingers for a bit. Medium light lacing and fairly long legs. 
Flavor has a light sweetness with some moderate dark caramel and toffee notes; not as super sweet as a lot of barley wines which is nice. Some light roast and medium light chocolate notes. Medium bitterness with faint pine hop notes. Medium bourbon character with light oak and medium light alcohol spice. 
Mouthfeel is medium to medium full bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and medium alcohol warmth. 
Overall a really nice barley wine; I really enjoy that it has a slightly darker malt profile and avoids the overly strong burnt sugar note that lots of barley wines have to them. Well balanced bitterness with faint hop character. A nice balanced beer with a lot of malt complexity.
On tap at CBC 2014. Dark amber with no head. Aroma and taste with lots of bourbon, toffee, burnt sugar, alcohol, barrel, vanilla. Powerful and vinous
2013. Rusty red almost putplish pour, tan head that disappears fast. Nose is citrus, caramel, vanilla, big candy apple. Taste is candy apple, vanilla, barrel. Sticky mouthfeel.

Draught @ CBC2014. Pours clear dark auburn with a tiny tan head. Aroma is bourbon, fudge, oak, candy, dried fruit, raisin, vanilla, plenty of booze and coconut. Taste is heavy sweet and moderate bitter. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is moderate. Finishes dry, boozy and warming.

On tap @ Copenhagen Beer Celebration 2014. A deep and really dark amber looking one. It actually has a small sidesticking and lightly lacing beige head. On the nose its really nice. Nutty caramel, lots of sweet vanilla and clear bourbon. You can almost sense it by the aroma how sticky this will be in the mouth. A little bit of chocolate also found in the aroma. Really nice. Lots and lots of sweet vanilla and bourbon in the taste also. Warming the throat in a great way. Its not as super sticky in the mouth as I thought really, some though, and its soft and prickling on the bubbles. Quite flavorful indeed this one! One of those who deserves a whole evening just to be enjoyed at home. 03.05.2014

2012 bottle, caramel brown pour, with virtually no head, lots of sediment in the latter half of the bottle. Aroma, oak, vanilla, brown sugar and caramel. Taste, sweet up front, sticky mouthfeel, that morphs into liquid caramel, with no hint from the booze. Overall, a damn tasty barley wine.

12oz brown bottle, 2012 vintage. Bottleshare at Ferris. Brown and murky in the glass, headless. Nose has toffee and bourbon. Taste has caramel, wood. Finishes with more caramel and light hops. Medium body and mild carbonation. Good stuff.
Bottle - Vintage 2012 - Nutty, caramel and a butter finish. Cloudy brown with no head. Nice sweet caramel and a light caramel finish. Really nice mellow and sweet with long great finish.

Draft @ CBC 2014. Pours an amber color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity malty spicy bourbon aroma with hints of caramel. Sweetish malty woody bourbon and caramel flavor. Has a sweetish malty woody bourbon and caramel finish.

Tap sample at CBC 2014. Deep cognac-hued mahogany brown body, small off-white head. Nose is peanuts, wood, caramel, bourbon, brown sugar and hints of toffee, cream and booze. Taste is deep caramel, creamy toffee tones, wood, peanuts, bourbon, alcohol, hints of brown sugar and grains. Full, smooth body, medium to soft carbonation. Lovely bourbonized barley wine from the so-often-splendid Kuhnhenn.

Sample @ CBC, Pours clear dark red with an off-white head. Very nice aroma of bourbon, caramel, vanilla, oak, dried fruit, earth. Taste is sweet dried fruit, vanilla, bourbon and light bitter, some dry woody notes. Mediumd/full smooth oily body with soft carbonation.
Tap @ CBC14-red. Dark mahogany. Very bourbony vanilla, rich plummy malty nose. Full body. Soft, with raisins, caramel sweetness. Bourbony oaky vanilla. Bit too much though.

4 ounce draft pour (2013) into a snifter at ChurchKey during the Kuhnhenn SAVOR event. Pours dark brown with light tan head. Aromas of bourbon, caramel, dark fruit, toffee. Tasting notes of bourbon, caramel, dark fruit, booze. Medium body with a dry and warm finish. Syrupy mouthfeel. Very nice!
Smokey, bourbony, awesome. Pours light black with good head and lacing. Some booze. Finishes a little sweet with some bourbon. Comes together very well - great barley wine. Tap takeover at Churchkey.

Draft at CBC 2014. Pours a dark red color with a small off-white head. The aroma is sweet, malty and fruity. The taste is of malt, dark sugary fruits, vanilla and bourbon. Aftertaste is very very fruity with a great deal of alcohol in it. Full body and high carbonation - feels very fizzy and bubbly on the tongue. Good intense Barley Wine,

Taster, on tap, 2013 version, 16 % abv, at the third session, Copenhagen Beer Celebration. Rosewood coloured body. Film-type layer at the surface. Vapour of bourbon joined by bread-like malts and vanilla oak. Flavours of bread, prunes, caramel, and integrated alcohol. Sweet malty ending. Very smooth vinous impression. Great sipper qualities (03.05.2014).
At CBC. Dark copper colour with off-white head. Bourbon, wood and vanilla aroma. Caramel, vanilla, sweet taste, creamy. Medium to full body.
On draft at Churchkey in DC. Pours a clear dark cola with a tan head Aroma of bourbon. Flavors of oak, vanilla, dark cherries and of course bourbon. Smooth viscous mouthfeel Lingering booze finish.

On tap at Church Key. Pours a hazy dark brown, no light passes. Lacing and sugary bubbles cling to the glass, no head. Aroma is rich and sweet: malts, toffee, oak & vanilla, dark sugar, caramel, with notes of chocolate. Flavor is classic English barley wine with boozy bourbon out front. Sweet roasty toffee finish.
Tap, CK. Hazy nut brown. Lots of savory bourbon, fig, earth, wood, and setting vanilla aromas. Nice resins hop, but quickly subsumed by bourbon. Wood, and warming booze finish. Thicker velvety body.

Sample at CBC 2014. (vintage 2013, 16%)

Brownish with a small head. Aroma and taste of bourbon, sweet malt, dried fruit, vanilla, oak and toffee. The mouthfeel was thick. Long warming finish. A nice beer.

Sampled @ CBC 2014. Clear dark red color, small beige head. Aroma is moderate to heavy malty and heavy bourbon. Really nice full aroma. Loads of bourbon, malts, liquor, wood and slightly alcohol in the taste. Warming alcohol finish. Very nice!

CBC 2014. Pours mahogany with a low tan head. Aromas of caramel, burnt sugar, figs, dates, honey, dark dried berries, oak and vanilla. Wow! Just a lovely aroma. Taste is caramel, figs, dates, burnt sugar, honey, vanilla. Aftertaste is caramel, honey, figs, dates. Very very good indeed!

Tap @CBC2014
Dark copper-brown color, small beige head. Strong aroma of toffee and vanilla. Full-bodied. Lots of bourbon and vanilla. Alcohol, warming. Strong and a bit sticky. Quite sweet but nice dessert beer when you have it in small quantities.

Draught @ CBC 2014, Copenhagen. Pours a dark brown colour with a small head. Aroma of bread, toasted malts, bourbon and some wet earth. Rich flavour of sweet caramel, toasted malts, grass, bourbon, wood and mild vanilla. Full bodied and a vinous, toasty, swet finish. Vinous.

Tap @ CBC14.
Pours clear dark red color with no head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla, ripe fruits and some berries. Flavor of syrup, bourbon, dark toasted malts, caramel, some tar and brown sugar. Sweet n sticky palate, alcohol is very nicely hidden, an excellent dessert delicacy.
5427

Draught @ CBC14
Vintage 2013, 16%
Aroma is stale and a total vanilla overdose. Very sweet and syrupy. Flavour has strong bourbon tones, sweet malt and caramel. Despite all the sweetness and strong aromas, this feels balanced. A slow sipper for a long evening.

Pours deep clear brown with yellowish head. Aroma of butterscotch, toffee, light grapefruit and resin. Taste is sweet, toffee, caramel, lingering sweet finish. Rich, creamy body with soft carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught @ CBC 2014
Pours brown with a smooth head. Aroma of bourbon, wood, vanilla, sweet syrup, caramely malts, toffee and fudge. Taste is smooth, heavy and sticky with loads of bourbon, vanilla, toffee and oaky wood. Finish is sweetish, heavy and bourbony with loads of caramely malts, oak, vanilla, toffee and syrup. Quite heavy but well balanced BA barley wine.

CBC 2014
Pours mahogny high off white head
Aromas of vanilla, bourbon, brown sugar
Taste immense of barley malts, butterscotch, bourbon, vanilla, liqourise, alcohol

Bottle sample at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks DSG. 2013 bottle. 14%. Pours clear brown with a medium head, aroma is outstanding with Bourbon, vanilla, toffee, werthers original, flavor of toffee, bourbon, vanilla chocolate and plums, full bodied, amazing.

Somewhat translucent amber brown, light beige lacing. Sweet aroma of caramel, pear, charred oak, apple, raisin, vanilla, and butterscotch. Sugary sweetness with a little dried fruit tannic character. Smooth, fairly viscous, and full-bodied. Bourbon booziness in the lingering finish.
At 2014 MBG Winterset. Deep hazy brown. Dried fruit, sugar, caramel and booze. Smooth and tasty.
Strong aroma and quite rightly so! 2010 vintage, with singing flavours. Drink with a glass of water as this is serious. Look at the legs running down the side of the glass as its so strong

Bottle shared thanks to spdyfire83. Pours hazy brown with no head. Aroma of caramel, vanilla, malt, biscuit, raisins. Flavour is heavy sweet and light moderate bitter. Alcohol warmth in the finish. Full bodied with soft carbonation.

33cl bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis. Big thanks!
No head. No carbonation. Hazy amber pour. Alcohol burn but well hidden alcohol. Very smooth. Lovely

Bottle at home with friends, courtesy of Aaron. Thanks man!! Pour is murky brown with no head. Big caramel, figs, raisins, dates, prunes, nutty, bready, and brown sugar aroma. Taste is slightly oxidized, leathery, tangy, ripe figs, caramel, soy sauce, light vanilla, and candi sugar. Slick mouthfeel with soft carbonation. Really easy-drinking barleywine and hard to believe it is 15%+. Nice stuff.

At Stephens House with Stephen, Aaron, and Dave. Pours dark murky bronze. Aroma is huge pungent awesome caramel fig raison, old malt. Taste is rounded caramel malt, nice old musky notes, burnt sugars.

At a tasting, thanks DSG, clear very dark brown colour, suprising aroma of fresh berries and plums with dark bread,werthers original candy, strong werthers flavour and dried fruits flavour with some alcohol showing through but not feeling to heavy. Nice but not too great.

Bottle shared at a tasting at Beer Market Jaffa. Thanks troganmi for this bottle! 2013 bottle. 14%. Clear dark amber-brown with a tan head. Wonderful aroma of malt, cookies, bourbon, vanilla and some chocolate. Sweet flavor, malty, cookie-ish, with caramel, chocolate, vanilla, dark fruits, wood and some bourbon. Lovely rounded full body. Really great stuff!
Draft at MBG Winter Festival - pours a hazy brown. Caramel, toffee, and bourbon aromas. Fair amount of alcohol. Lots of caramel and dark fruit flavors. Excellent .

Bottle received in trade. Thank you lionsandbeer! Pours tiny hazy mahogany brown with a very small offwhite head that quickly dissipates without leaving much trace on the glass. Smell is sweet and malty with caramel, biscuits, vanilla fudge, caramelized almonds, bourbon, toffee, butterscotch hard candy, charred US oak, toasted coconut, tingling alcohol, raisins in rum, figs in brandy and hints of cocoa powder, amaretto and bourbon. Taste is sweet and malty with toasted malts, caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, sweet liquorice candy, bourbon, roasted nuts, caramelized almonds, hay, charred US oak, sweet dark bread, hay, raisins, dates, brown sugar and hints of cocoa powder. Mouthfeel is round, creamy, soft, tiny boozy and full bodied. Finish is sweet, tiny bitter, malty and fruity with caramel, toffee, vanilla fudge, charred US wood, raisins, dates, roasted nuts and bourbon. Smooth and incredibly rich. One of the top barley wines Ive ever tried.

Bottle, huge thanks to Alex (_angst_)!!! Clear amber/mahogany beer with a small head. Hazelnut aroma, malty, fruity, caramel, raisins, toffee, plums, candy notes, dades, vanilla, woody, cream notes, bourbon, some licorice. Malty vanilla flavor, caramel, licorice, raisins, hazelnuts, warming alcohol, bourbon, dades, raisins, cream, chocolate notes, cocoa powder, earthy notes. Lovely mouthfeel, full bodied, alcohol is well hidden. Perfection! So glad I was given the chance to try this beer, Alex!
Bottle. Aroma bourbon, honey, treacle. Taste nice, treacle, chewy, sweet. Good stuff.

2011 bottle. Huge bourbon nose, vanilla, coconut, cola, cherry, chocolate. Cloudy, dark brown, with lace. Nice caramel old ale flavor, chocolate, raisin, honey, and of course bourbon. Mostly bourbon. Very nice but the beer character does not come through quite enough for greatness.

Bottle. Thanks deyholla. Pours a clear amber with a small beige head. Aroma of bourbon, fruit, and caramel. Taste is bourbon, dark fruit, caramel malt, and vanilla. Some alcohol comes through. Very nice to sip on.
Big thanks to HisBoyElroy on this split. Extremely good beer. Very good smell taste and feel. So all around great beer.

Bottle 2011 vintage poured a clear reddish brown with a lingering ring of tan foam. Aromas of prune, toffee, caramel, tobacco, light bourbon and light oak. Palate was full bodied and smooth. Flavors of toffee, fruitiness, tobacco, light bourbon and light oak with a smooth lingering fruity toffee finish.

Bottle courtesy of dkachur at the 15th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering on 07/16/2011. 2008 bottle. Clear deep amber body with a small frothy white head. Big bourbon, blue cheese, and caramel aroma. Big bourbon, vanilla, blue cheese and caramel flavor. Full body with moderately low carbonation.

Picked up a 2013 bottle from the brewery's Winter Solstice event today. Pours a very dark red, almost black with no head. Aroma of bourbon, vanilla ,dark fruits, chocolate fudge and slight alcohol. Getting a lot of coconut, vanilla and dark cherries in the taste. No real alcohol in the taste, which is hard to believe at 14%. Medium mouthfeel. Coconut after taste lingers for some time. World class brew. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
2009. Schwerer, deutlich alkoholischer Antrunk mit eher wenig Aromen. Etwas brennend, wenig getreidig, wenig würzig malzig. Zum Ende schokoladig, brennend alkoholisch. 7/11/10/11/9/9

2012

Pours hazy mahogany with little head or carbonation.

Smell huge pungent red fruit, sticky toffee, rum soaked raisins.

Taste vanilla, oak, caramel, toffee, hint of booze on the end.

Smooth (for 15%) and full bodied.

If you are in to big beers, this is one you must try.

A-bourbon, caramel-med malt. T-bourbon, caramel-med malt, spice hops. Alcohol bite/hot still.

Bottle, 2012 - thanks deyholla! Pours clear ruby hazel with a tiny tan head that nonetheless has nice lacing. Aroma is bourbon, molasses, toffee, cherries, figs, dates. Flavor is the same, sweet and hot with some astringence and woody notes. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel, somewhat flat. A bit hot, but not really much considering the ABV. Nice beer, not amazing.

12 oz bottle (2010 vintage), shared by Matt B -- Thanks! The bottle ominously bubbled up a bit upon opening. The pour was a clear amber with a practically still surface. Gigantic, lasting soy sauce finish is the biggest thing that really stood out to me about this - bummer. Aside from that, theres caramelized brown sugar, bourbon, just the smallest hint of oxidation. Full body, slick, syrupy texture. Remarkably smooth, with the alcohol well-masked. Overall: pretty awesome even with its flaws. Intense.

Dark brown of color with a fast disappering beige head. An aroma of sweets, prunes, port, vanilla, raisins and dark sugar. A flavor of alcohol, prunes, liqurice, spice, caramel, chocolate, nuts, woody and alcohol in the finish.

Dark brown pour with almost no head. Aromas of dark fruit, oak, cocoa, bourbon, and some yeast notes. Initial flavor is of raisin with notes of cocoa and dark fruit. Finishes with the oak and bourbon character. Very complex. Abv is well-hidden, barely noticeable in the finish but even then in that nice warming way. Truly a great beer.

12 oz bottle. 2011 bottle. Pours a dark brown color with a minimal head that soon disappears . The aroma is big and bold with dark fruits, bourbon and sherry. The taste is similar to the nose, I get bourbon, sherry, raisins, walnuts and dates. The palate is full and smooth with soft carbonation. Finishes long and dry with lingering sherry. Overall: A bit boozy but still excellent.

Bottle at THE Barley Wine Tasting - East Croydon. Thanks to Kenny for this 2009 vintage bottle. Pours cloudy amber with a faint, creamy foam head. Deep, dark sugary malt nose, some cheese notes. Big sweet flavor with hefty alcohol kick, coffee ice cream, caramel, dates. Big in body with finely carbonated. Hot finish with further coffee ice cream, lots of alcohol, chewy ripe fruits, salt, figs. Loads of alcohol heat here. Nothing special
2012 bottle. Deep brown with some haze and no head. Plum, sugar, caramel and booze. Holy wow. Just amazing. Completely hides the ABV. First 20 overall I've ever given.
12 ounce bottle. Pours a darker brown with a beige head of foam. Aroma is bread, chocolate, bourbon, fig, raisin, malt. Tastes very sweet and malty. Really nice stuff overall.

Tempting aroma and dark pour with a smoother than expected taste and warming mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: OCT 13, 2013 Bottle thanks to tom10101 again, someone stop this guy!! Thanks! Pours a clear copper with a low carbonation level hence almost no head. Not really a defect for a barleywine. Aroma is really and rich, with a lot of brown sugar and a little rubbing alcohol. Taste is more of the same but now with toffee, syrup and various sweets notes. As mentionned earlier the carbonation was soft so texture was oily, thick, sticky... quite fun! Overall a really nice BW, bourbon was discrete but this is how we like it!

Bottle shared by someone during RBWG-JAX. Thanks! Dark amber brown pour with a small tan head. Rich BA aroma, fudge, coconut, etc. melds well with underlying dark fruits, molasses, brown sugar, etc. The flavor shows nice BA intermingling with tasty barleywine, maybe a hint of booze and oxidation. Still tasty!

2011. Body is dark brown/black, minimal beads of white head & lace. Boozy, complex aroma showcases the bourbon character amidst sweet malts. Alcoholic, yet age-y and fantastic.

Plenty of bourbon against the barleywine backbone. Tons going on here: caramel sweetness, bready, barrel character, boozy warmth. Arguably the best barleywine I've ever tasted; I actually prefer this over KH. Truly unfortunate that I don't have any more of these :(

2010 is more boozy and leathery, lacks the same magic found in the '11. Need more of the '11 ASAP!

Pours still, tea brown....
Aroma is rich wood, and earth, molasses...
Flavour is thickly barley malt, chocolate....baked bread/cake....vanilla.
Very sweet and rich.
Bourbon and accompanying ABV are well masked....the chocolate mutes the bourbon down well..
Very smooth, very good.

Bottle 2011 courtesy of FlandersNed. Bourbon, wood, and barley malt aroma. Murky chestnut with a minimal head. Syrupy sweet molasses and barley malt flavor - like a molasses cookie. Nice smooth bourbon flavor, without being hyper boozy and overpowering. Full sticky body.
Bottle.   Raisin, light chocolate barley malt, and bourbon aroma.  Murky brown with no head.  Very sweet molasses and barley malt flavor with hint of bourbon.   Light bitter herbal finish.  Smooth.
2010 bottle - now this bad boy will chase those winter nights away! Dark amber pour, slightly hazy. Malt, toffee and caramel strongly in the nose and taste. The bourbon is strong in this one.

2010 bottle in a trade with deyholla. Poured 2/12/13. Deep amber brown pour, somewhat cloudy, and with no head whatsoever. Aroma of plums, vanilla, bourbon, oak, caramel, and toffee. Nice. Hot bourbon up front that smooths into a very sweet vanilla toffee on the back of the palate. Long lingering oaky vanilla. Medium to heavy on the palate. Alcohol warmth is there, but not overly boozy. Never had a fresh one so it could be the age. Unexpectedly smooth for 15.1%. A top barley wine for me.

UPDATED: OCT 12, 2014 13th November 2011Hazy brown beer with a short lived pale tan head. Smooth dry palate. Toasted coconut, bourbon and bitterish hops. Dry wood and booze. An undertone of vanilla oak. A bit clunky but quite enjoyable. 3rd May 2014CBC Session 3. 16.0% version. Clear red - amber beer, small pale cream colour head. Palate is smooth with a minerally crisp back end. Sweet vanilla oak. Bourbon spice and bourbon fruity tang blends well with the vanilla wood. Little dried fruits. Light crisp finish. Hugely drinkable.

Bottle, amazing extra courtesy of bulldogp04, cheers Dean! Hazy tea pour with very scant head, tons fo buttery caramel in aroma, veru rich and inviting, flavor si same super rich, sweet, butterscoth acn caramel, a smooth flavorful elixer, 15% abv nearly indetectable, a truly amazing brew, so glad I got to try it!

2010 and 2011 vintage.  Murky reddish brown pour with no head.  Nose of sweet malt and booze.  Taste is sweet with tons of caramel, toffee, vanilla, wood, and booze.  Thick mouthfeel that coats the palate.  One of favorites in one of my favorite styles.

Clear brown / light red color. Minimal khaki head. Couple dots of lace. With little swirling, some head appears. Actually leaves good lace. That swirling bring out the awesome woody bourbon nose - vanilla, typical bourbon fruity notes, other complexities in there.. Maybe some shellfish? Wow, really amazing but subtle fruity flavor. So smooth, light sweet, not cloying at all. Fruity, caramel malts, chocolate, very tasty. 15% is noticeable, but in sips works very well, very smooth, relatively well-blended, really. Creamy, bigger body. Very light carbonation. Good rich bourbon fruity aftertaste. Excellent barley wine.

Bottle. Poured clear reddish brown color with an average fizzy off-white head that mostly lasted with good lacing. Moderate to heavy dark fruit, toasted malt, bourbon alcohol and vanilla wood aroma. Full body with a smooth texture and flat carbonation. Moderate to heavy dark fruit bourbon vanilla sweet flavor with a medium to heavy dark sweet finish of moderate to long duration. This is a complex standout beer.

[4961-20121118] 12floz bottle. Aroma of toasted bread soaked in roasted salty soya sauce. Slightly hazy, dark cola body with no head. Roasted salted soya sauce malt flavour. Full sweet body. Noticeable wood throughout but its not overpowering. (6/3/7/3/14) 3.3
(w/ jercraigs)
December 29, 2012 - bottle at Bretts tasting. Cloudy brown pour with no head.  Bourbon, caramel, and dark fruit in aroma and taste.  Thick and smooth to drink.

Traded 2009 bottle. Look, aroma and flavor are fairly true to form except...I get a really strong mineral/sediment/earth taste. For my own reference it reminds me of Fort Worth tap water. The 15 ABV hits a little hard but to be expected. Good but probably a little "too big" for me.

Bottle @ home from Secret Santa 2013.....It pours cloudy amber with no head.....The aroma is bourbon, vanilla, dark fruits and caramel.....The flavor is very nice sweet bourbon, dark fruits, vanilla and caramel.....
Insanely huge BBBW. Big malty sweetness, caramal,m smooth bourbon. Smooth beer but a few oz is all you need.

On tap. A nice diminishing head that turns into lacing on my glass. The scent of bourbon hits my nose intensely. It is followed by carmel malts. The BBBW flows with malt and bourbon flavor. The bourbon is more tamed than the scent led me to believe. The sweet roasted malts lend a hand to balance things out. In the end there is slight bitterness and minor dryness. Overall this is a very tasty beverage.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle from the CheeseMan.  2009 variety.  Thanks Daniel!  It pours a muddy, reddish brown with no head at all.  There seems to be prickly carbonation, but this brew cant muster any head at all.  The nose is a potent mix of brown sugar, treacle, fruit cake, bread.  The flavor seems to follow suit with the nose.  A good up front sweetness with hints of date, dark caramel, dark bread, light wood, and light bourbon.  The alcohol is certainly there, but it dries things out nicely on the back end which is good given the complete lack of carbonation.  Definitely warming on the way down, this one is a sipper.  Great flavor and balance given the ABV, I would love to have a few more of these.

2012-11-18. Murky dark brown body, headless. Big aroma, bourbon, light wood, alcohol and tangy rich malt character. Flavour is similar, lots of bourbon character, support sweet malt core, tangy fruity character lends itself to a fairly dry warming finish. Surprisingly bitter. Smooth average plus to medium bodied palate is essentially still. Some carbonation would go a long way to make this lighter on the palate. Has nice highlights, but leaves the mouth tingly with alcohol and sits pretty heavily on the palate. Decent but lacks the nuance and sophistication to take it up a notch. Bottle, note on cap says 12/2011 via trade with flandersned

12oz bottle, 2010 vintage, dark amber color, with a ring of beige head, nice sweet caramelized, toasted, biscuity malty, vanilla bourbon barrel oaky nose with some brown sugar, light maple syrup, sugar pie, plum pudding accents, with a faint french toast, butterscotch pudding note in the aroma follows through on a full-bodied palate with a warmth, sweet strong vanilla bourbonish oak barrel, coconut, caramelized sugar, toffee, dried raisin, date fruity character, with some cookie dough, faint maple syrup, english pudding, toasted, caramel, biscuity maltiness flavours, leading towards a warming sweet toasty, caramel maltiness, dried frutiness, bourbonish, vanilla finish.

UPDATED: JUL 14, 2013 2011 vintage. 12 oz. bottle, sent from northernbrews (thanks a lot, Jeff!), pours a deep dark mahogany with almost no head, just a small beige ring. Aroma brings out some deep, lush bourbon barrels, some alcohol liqueur notes, and toffee and brown sugar further back. Flavour brings out the bourbon barrels big time, but never in a distasteful way, full of brown sugar, some kind of sweet boozy liqueur, loads of caramel and toffee, and alcohol. This is big n bold, alright, and executed with supreme skill. So much depth, with a luxurious mouthfeel. Though it is sweet, it doesnt suffer from cloying sweetness like so many Kuhnhenn beers do. One of my all-time favourite barley wines.

bottle from david paquet, shared also with minderbinder and tom10101. many thanks! hazy light brown, red tint, with a small but nice off-white head, some retention. dark figs, tobacco, roastiness, cherries, vegetal, warming alcohol, chocolate, pepper. soft carbonation, medium body, nice lightly acidic-grassy finish. my best bw to date.

Bottle 355ml. [2011]
Pours hazy brown, almost no head. Aroma is of bread, raisins, fruits, alcohol, bourbon. Taste is of bread, raisins, plums, dark fruits, sweetness, very sligth bourbon, warming alcohol. Overall: Excellent and impressive beer. A sipper. My kind of stuff.

Bottle (12 oz) 2011. Huge thanks to David for sharing this one! Hazy dark amber with no head and some lacing. Aroma is of malt, bread, red and dark fruits, caramel, raisins and bourbon. Amazing complexity here! It taste like liquid bread. Same here as aroma but with hints of tobacco and bourbon being a little more present. Mouthfeel is oily and alcohol is warming. Near perfect balance. Nice sipper!

Bottle 12 oz, big thx to Greg. Pours beautiful deep red mahogany with a nice beige shortlived head. Aroma is sweet malty raisins fidges vanilla some bourbon fruity madeira wine and alcohol. Flavor is smooth fruity very malty raidins vinous alcohol good bitterness a bit pungent vanilla and some bourbon. Finishes bitter malty with a touch of alcohol snd bourbon.

2011 Bottle with Bill during the birds game. Pours a deep brown with red hues, barely any head or lacing to note. Aromas of bourbon, wood, dark fruit, candy sugar, and malts. Taste is plums, cocoa, cherries, brown sugar, bourbon, and oak. Mouthfeel is velvety smooth slightly syrup.  and layered with flavors. Reminds me of a perfectly cellared thomas hardy. Full bodied. Top 3 barleywine for me.
UPDATED: DEC 23, 2013 Bottle. Murky reddish brown pour with a small white head. Huge aroma and flavor of caramel, some chocolate, wood, bourbon, and vanilla. Rich and delicious. Amazing.

Bottle @ THE Barley Wine Tasting. Cheers to Ken for sourcing this top want! The pour resembles hazy brown apple cider, tiny head. The nose is HUGE blue cheese funk, hobbits feet. Some notes of apple, but cheese really dominates the aroma. The taste is strong boozy sweetness, some wood and plum-dipped chocolate. The finish has plenty of salt and the return of cheesy flavors. Clearly this isnt on top form. Big body, a real sipper. Overall, a disappointment!

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2012 Bottle, thanks to Ken at THE Barley Wine Tasting, August 2012. It pours murky deep brown, with no head. The nose is initially strongly cheesy, brie, stinky feet and Wotsits, as well as vanilla, toasted coconut, toffee and meatiness. The taste is thankfully a bit better....toffee, caramel, wood, dry leather, light saltiness, toast, bourbon, waxy cheese rind and alcohol warmth. Full body, low carbonation and syrupy  mouth-feel. Pretty cheesy and alcoholic. A disappointment.

GTMW 2010? Pours to a brassy brown/dark caramel body with a thin light tan head.  Huge complex aroma of vanilla, oak, barley, and some sort of fruit.  Flavors are similar and very complex.  Delicious.  Perfect palate of sweetness balanced by a medium texture.

A-- Poured a deep, dark amber brown. Great looking ruby hues to this. Little to no head at all. Just a thin layer of film with this. Lots of spotty lacing on the sides of the glass and ABV legs.

S-- Holy crap!!! Rich bourbon, total kick in the ass smell. Big amounts of bourbon, melted brown sugar, Carmel, vanilla, toasted oak and dark fruits. Spent several minutes just smelling the nose on this. 

T-- Matches the nose but bigger. Sublime taste as just blends very well together with the barrel. Still get the dark fruits and bits of strawberry jam. Not a lot of hops so a dead give away that this is more slanted to an English Barleywine. Kick ass beer.

M-- Rich, thick, decadent. Sublime really. Silky smooth. Biggest fault is the obvious alcohol. Very obvious sipper, still quite smooth though. Heavy feel and low carbonation. Honestly a beast of a beer. 

O-- Damned good. One is enough though. Heck, honestly this beer is a monster. Would love to have again. Not as good or as rounded as MOAS, or older vintages of Arctic Devil but pretty much a world class beer worth looking for and hording as much as possible

Bottle @ Camons tasting, courtesy of adnielsen. Hazy orangey brown with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, caramel, dried fruit, vanilla and bourbon. Flavor is very sweet and rather bitter. Very sweet and rather bitter finish with warming alcohol. Oily. Really nice. 120712

Bottle shared by Thorpe429 and Amyliz4. Thanks Mike and Amy!

Served in a blind taste test with Alpine Great and Central Waters Bourbon Barrel Barleywine.

A: This beer appears brown and hazy, with a thin, wispy head that leaves a few random traces of lacing on the glass.

S: Bourbon, sweet malt, toffee, caramels, oak.

T: Sweet raisins, plums, toffee, and dark fruits, all soaked in alcohol. This is a potent brew, and well done.

M: Medium-thin in body, with a fairly low carbonation level.

D: A great beer for sharing, or slowly sipping over the course of an hour or two. Perfect for a rainy, wintry day.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 01-07-2011

A hazy red/brown colored beer, with a small beige head. thearoma of vanilla, fruits like apricot with alcohol. The taste of sweet alcohol, vanilla, wood and fruits. The aftertaste is burny, sweet alcohol with dry in the back.
12 ounce thanks to MP. Big and boozy. Not so much bourbon but strong whiskey aroma and taste. Caramel. Tons of brown sugar. Its a big boozy sweet beer. Intense. I probably should have shared.

Bottle @ home, courtesy of Adnielsen, thanks Aaron. Pours dark golden with a small ring of offwhite foam along the glasssides. Flavor of malt, barley, caramel, oak, bourbon, sweets. Flavor is rich malt, caramel, sweets, oak, bourbon, wood. Full body, soft carbonation, very smooth and easy drinkable for the ABV. Wonderfull and smooth beer, thanks again!! 120712

Bottle courtesy of adnielsen. Dark amber/brown with small off-white head. Aroma is malt, dark fruits, toffee, rip fruits, little vanilla with notes of alcohol. Flavour is malt, dried fruits, sweet, toffee, hops, little bitter, plume, raisins vanilla with notes of alcohol.
Everything works together for this beer. Wonderful flavor and aroma. Like drinking oak and whiskey aged candy (though the sweetness is not over the top).

12 oz bottle from lionsandbeer 2011 vintage. Nose is black raisin pie, vanilla, toffee, and musty and bourbon hints. Murky brown with a very small beige head. Flavor is very sweet raisins, toffee bitterness, and some toffee. Finishes sweet with some light background bitterness from the syrupy body.
Pours a glowing red color with a small off white head.  Vanilla, bourbon with a little toffee dominating the nose and taste flavors.  This is very yummy and awesome.

12 oz bottle generously shared by colonelforbin.  Thanks Mike.  Pours a dark brown with very small white head that settles to a ring and leaves close to no lacing on the glass.  The aroma is big caramel, toasted marshmallow, bourbon, toasted oak, and vanilla.  The taste is sweet with oak, caramel, bourbon, toasted marshmallow, and vanilla.  The finish has a bit of lingering oak.  Medium-full body.  Low carbonation.  Quite enjoyable.

Poured into a snifter. 2011 vintage. Big thanks to Urbancaver for hooking me up.

3.5 A: Murky dark brown color. Just a quarter finger of tannish head than falls quickly and leaves very little lacing. Kuhnhenn has little time to worry about their beers asthetics.

5.0 S: Aggressive, complex, yet extremely complementary. Thick, rich caramel and toffee. Huge raisin, tobacco, plum, prune, and date slap the smell receptors silly. Only mildy boozy despite the huge ABV. Bourbon and barrel add more complexity to an already superbly complex base. Leather, light peat, earth, and melon fruits in addition to oak and vanilla from the barrel.

4.5 T: Tastes like the nose, but isnt as aggressive (how could it be, really?). Huge raisin, prune, tobacco, plum and all that jazz. Again the booze is hidden very well. Big sweetness, but nothing out of hand and definitely not Bruery level. Leather, peat, earth, melon, vanilla, oak. Wonderful taste.

4.5 M: Heavy body. Carbonation is on the lower end of acceptable. Rich, palpable thickness without necessarily being overly chewy.

5.0 D: A taste could have also been a 5.0, so Ill add it here. Really wonderful beer. Kuhnhenn are masters at hiding booze while delivering the amount of flavor that you can only get from a huge ABV beer. Not quite as good as BB4D, but damn close.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 05-29-2012 03:04:49

Thin tan head thats short lived, little lace. Clear, mahogany colored brew, ruby edging. Nose is boozy, whisky, dark fruits, grain. Full bodied with a soft carbonation, chewy, slick on the palate, oily. Whisky/boozy notes balancing out the malty sweetness, notes of caramel and dark fruit, plum, raisin, gentle woody notes, vanilla and cocoa, lil earthy. Warm, lasting finish. Surprisingly decent. Bottle from WeisGuy.

2011 bottle poured in a snifter.  Big bourbon aroma along with toffee, raisins, butterscotch, and dark fruit.  Taste is extremely sweet up front which mellows as the bourbon comes through.  Lots of fruit, raisins, and toffee to go with the bourbon.  The sweet taste remains on the tongue for a really long time.  I really like this beer but I wonder what would happen to it in a few years.  I hope I can have the patience to wait.

Dark amber pour with a small off white head. Huge fruity notes, caramel malt and toffee with mild sherry like oxidation. Think rich palate with a sweet finish. A great beer, but perhaps doesnt deserve the hype.

Bottle on my 32nd birthday.  Pours an almost clear but dark amber brown with tan head that fizzes out to nothing in just a few seconds.  Smell is dark aged fruits, biscuit, thick creamy caramel, bourbon shows notes of vanilla, oak and some booze.  Taste starts off a thick creamy vanilla toffee and lends to the dark fruits, some leather, biscuit.  Some alcohol but as it warms and the abv creeps in, the beer is actually really smooth.   Overall for 10% or 15% this beer is amazing.  Just shows truly what barrel aging can do for a beer.

12 ounce bottle. Tons of bourbon and wood. Fruity alcohol, raisins, malty, caramel, vanilla. There is not much balance between the barrel aging and the barely wine. Not a bad beer, but does not hold my interest. I feel it would improve with some age.

A: Poured a murky reddish brown color with good carbonation and a nice tan cap

S: Big bourbon influence, plenty of heat with some big dark fruits: i can literally pick them out...figs,prunes and a fresh raisin. Some toffee and, wood and vanilla

T: Heat but not as bad as many beer from this brewery. The sugary sweetness of 4d turned me off but this beer is a bit more balanced and rounded if you can call this balanced lol. Figs, plums, raisins, with toffee, caramel and brown sugar and some Earthy wood notes.

M: Big body, a bit thin on the mouthfeel with heat going down. I felt the body should have been a bit bigger for a beer of this weight

O: Good but not the best. Worth a try for sure.

damn, my first Kuhnhenn and its a mess! .. 2010 bottle .. . pours a murky deep tan .. light foam .. . light bourbon and melted old chocolate, some odd leather too .. . ouch, something went very wrong here .. . . im gonna rob that bitch tonight..

2010 Bottle.
Pours red without any head.
A very boozy brew, heavy but short lasting taste. Smooth mouthfeel. Sweet, taset of plums and dark fruits and some bourbon.

Bottle. Aroma has got some nice bourbon, vanilla and chocolate. Slightly smoked and salty. Does not taste like a traditional barley wine. Its however quite enjoyable, altough a bit one dimensional. Too alcoholic and sharp. Short taste.

2008 bottle. Pours dark copper with just a trace of fizzy, off-white head. Aroma is bourbon, dark fruit (mostly figs), smoke, caramel and cookie malt, and oak. Flavor is sweet malt and fruit esters with bourbon taste throughout; dry, semi-sweet finish. Medium body, low carbonation, and high warmth.

Bottle shared by Ryan.  Pours clear tawny with little to no head.  Aroma is light sherry and brown sugar, dates and figs, spicy alcohol, cookie and caramel malt.  Flavor is malt dominant with sweet dates and figs, spicy alcohol and a sweet finish.  Some oak and light smoke notes cone in late.  Full body, high warmth and light carbonation.

Bottle thanks to FlandersNed.  Deep brown with red hues and a thin off-white head that quickly dissipates.  Amazing aroma of sweet, dark cherry, bourbon-soaked, candied plums and raisins, sweet molasses, caramel, dark fruit, a hint of mustiness and some booze.  Flavor is candied dark fruit, raisins, molasses, and woody bourbon.  Thick, sticky mouthfeel that coats the palate.  Lingering wood and sweet, dark fruit.  Sweetness makes this a sipper.  Booze, while fairly apparent in the aroma, is barely noticeable in the flavor or finish.  Top notch!

Bottle. Pours murky dark cola color with no head, but a tiny thin ring. Aroma is malt wood and caramel and some hints of dark cherries. Taste is rich caramel and wood with a nice dark dried cherry and sweet mellow bourbon. Palate is full and slick with a sticky dry finish. Really nice and the alcohol is well balanced and hidden.

From notes.  

The color is a ruby caramel brown with a transparent tan edge.  A small off-white cap leaves only an island after a few moments.

The aroma is sweet, deep, and complex.  Bourbon, caramel, lots of vanilla, and oak.

The flavor unwraps slowly, bringing out new layers as it warms.  Caramel, toffeet, and a bit of bready malt contribute to a sweet front.  There is some oak and vanilla next.  As the sip comes to a close, a bourbon presence really steps up and dominates.  It causes some tingling of the tongue, burn in the back of the throat, and warming of the stomach.  I can handle a strong bourbon presence, but this is almost over the top.  It might get better with some significant age on it.  

Other than that, this is a big-bodied barleywine, with enough booze and intensity to take on the strongest beer aficionado.

Bottle to snifter (thanks Mikem409). Looks good; dark and thick with minimal lacing. Smells great! Bourbon, candied cane, and molasses. Tastes excellent! This brewery really has the barreling down to a science! Mouthfeel is good as well. Overall, a fantastic brew that I really appreciate getting to try.

(12oz bottle from Rayl101 and a 2010 from ibrew2or3).  Drinking the 2010 version here in the Kuhnhenn glass sent by Rayl101.  Pours a hazy-almost cloudy-garnet/mahogany color with a tan head that rings the edge of the glass.  Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, coconut, marshmallow and some wood.  Taste is sweet with the the vanilla and coconut still coming through .  Medium to full bodied with a sticky texture.  There is some heat on the beer, but it drinks easily for 15% abv.  Really nice.

ed-amber, thin white head reduces to a ring. Nose is moderate oxidation, light caramel, juniper, and heat, pretty sugary. Flavor is more oxidized, minor fruit behind the oppressive cardboard and paper, thin sugary dates through end.

Nose chock full of alcohol - underneath theres vanilla, sweet caramel, buttescotch and bready malts.  Pours a nearly flat clear dark amber.  Its sweet, full of alcohol with substantial vanilla, bourbon and malt component.  A bit too boozy for my liking, but still quite tasty.

Brought this bottle that I received as an extra from a generous trading partner. Pours a deep mahogany in color with almost no head.  Slightly murky, but still see through when held to the light. Nose is rich with malt, bourbon, butterscotch, caramel, and light booze.  Flavor mirrors the nose with the booziness a little more in your face than the nose. Could probably benefit from some more time. Smooth mouthfeel despite the booziness. Full bodied with a long finish. Good barleywine, but probably doesnt touch the upper echelon of BA barleywines.  Still very good beer though.

This poured a murky amber color with a small beige head. Aroma was a good bit of broubon, lots of caramel, and some burnt cake there too .. Flavor was very sweet,but  not really cloying, almost watery actually, for the style, and lots of caramel nad toasted sweetness with some borubon heat. Just a bit disconjointed.

Had this at Ratebeers Horny Devil Pittsburgh Winter Tasting 2012. Big thanks to beerman6686 Dan for this brew!  Looks cloudy like iced tea. Very sweet aroma. Lots of alky impact of course. Flat. Yes, almost cloying sweet. As with most rude barley wines. Mouth coating alky impressions. How can anybody but an alchoholic really enjoy these rude barley wines? Finish is simply roto-tilling high alky stripper. Dan, thanks for cremating my taste buds, I owe you one!
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: 2010.  Hazy red-orange, whitish cover.  Aroma is caramel, oxidized, some bourbon.  Taste is caramel, some slightly papery oxidation, eh.

bottle 2011 vintage through trade. pour has a dark ruby brown color and a thin covering of off white head. aroma has rich malts, hefty alcohol, earthy chocolate, sweet bourbon, and vanilla. mouth feel is thick and coating with lower side carbonation but it is there. flavor gives you a big blast off the bat but it opens up as the glass goes on. super rich malts, bourbon, vanilla, some wood, molasses, bitter chocolate, and heat.

36cl, Vintage 2011, at 14.5%Vol, as Kuhnhenn Bourbon Barrel Aged Barley Wine, exclusive American brew, thx to Secret Santa!, complex brew, sweet/alcoholic and slightly malty/woody, heavy, yet balanced, hazy, nearly no head, good Winter brew, yet very expensive!, WOW!

Thanks to madmitch for that one. The small bottle looks really good. The beer in the glass dark brown, small head. Starts very strong, modest alcoholic, intense malty. Interesting notes of caramel and cacao. Finish more dominated by woody-earthy notes. So it could be a bit more balanced, but still a great beer!
Bottle shared by Bhensenb. Pours ruby and flat. Aroma is heavy raisin and malty vanilla. Flavor is vanilla and bourbon packing the heat.

Poured from 12 oz bottle.  Pours dark like cola with just a big of carbonation, but not much.  Aroma is caramel, toffee, prunes, vanilla, bourbon and dried fruits.  Taste is slightly sweet, like caramel.  Taste is pretty similar to the nose.  I would have expected a bit more sweetness.  This is one of my favorite styles...but it is just not as good as some other BA Barleywines I have had recently.
Pours copper with a small white head. Aroma is roasted caramel, alcohol, bourbon dried fruit, raisin and plum. Flavour is roasted caramel, heavy alcohol, burbon, raisin and plum.

Bottle at home - shared with Mette. Clead deep dark red/brown - white edges. Bourbon, vanilla, red berries, nutty, wooden, sharpness, alcoholic, coconut, dried fruits, light licorice, medium malty, ok sweetness, caramel, not too boozy..... nice.

2011 vintage.  Pours tan with little to no head.  The aroma is great, if you like bourbon.  The taste is smooth, but you can for sure taste the alcohol.  Kinda reminds me of the BB4D, which is a good thing.  It should age well.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a clear deep mahogany color with a small bubbly head.  The aroma has sweet caramel and toffee, bourbon, vanilla, smaller accents of fruit and wood.  The flavor has a big shot of sweet caramel, brown sugar, bourbon, vanilla and does get a touch boozy at times.  There is some woody character and some bitterness to the finish.  Medium plus body with a smooth mouth feel.  The alcohol does come through in this even after more than a year, but its not something that distracts.  

The 05 version is something special.  Much of the same in terms of nose and taste without the boozy alcohol.  The oxidation actually helps this a bit.

Pours a clear and reddish nutbrown beer with no head. The aroma is malt, sweetness, alcohol, dried fruit and vanilla. The flavor follows the nose. The palate is sweetness and alcoholwarmth. Overall a really good beer with complexity and balance.

2012. Just bottled and shared by Brad at Kuhnhenn. Pours dark toffee colored brown with small tan head. Aromas of sweet caramel, toffee, bourbon, vanilla, and coconut. Smelled amazing. Probably the best aroma I have ever experienced in a beer. Flavor of sweet caramel, rich bourbon, vanilla, toffee, and some molasses. There is some heat, but is insanely drinkable for such a big beer. Sweet and bourbony. So complex. Awesome beer.

bottle thanks to brad at kuhnhenn. this was 2011 batch shared with mark at kuhnhenn tap room. the aroma is so sweet and sexy it makes you want to have sex with it! the taste is like the first girl you ever kissed so complex it stuns you at first and you pull away suddenly but then snap back and go in for more. cant wait to buy at solstice.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2012 Bottle @ home, courtesy of maximum12. Huge thanks! Deep brown appearance with a small tan head. Unbelievable toasty, caramel malty, rich toffee, dark fruity, plum, bourbon, vanilla, oaky aroma. Super rich toffee, caramel malty, big vanilla, delicious bourbon, oak, more toffee flavor. No hint of the 15% abv until its half way down your throat. Holy fuck- this is easily one of the best beers Ive ever had. Huge malty, caramel, toffee flavor. I think I like Abacus a touch more but fuck, this could be the best beer Ive ever had for all I know. Update: this is a great mother fucking but isnt the best Ive had, as I previously considered.

2010 12 oz bottle big thanks to Aaron for the pour on this one.  Oour is dark reddish brown with thin off white head, aroma has notes of big vanilla, bourbon, some nice oak, wood, nice dark fruit, nice toffee and molasses notes, slight chocolate notes as well.  Wow.  Taste is not quite to the same level, but really awesome notes of bourbon, vanilla, chocolate, toffee, and molasses mixed together, the oak and wood dry it out nicely and make it really nice and balanced, the warmth of the 15% comes through but only in a good way.  Kuhnhenn, really nice work.

12 oz bottle courtesy of deyholla. Thanks, Derek! A cap on the Thanksgiving rates. Pours a luscious glowing brownish hue, amber glowing edges, a healthy haze and touches of murkiness with sunset edges and bottom. Small frothy tannish head dies to tiny ring, laces minimal. Aromas are rich toffee and caramel, touches of toast and vanilla, a rich dose of barrel and spirit, Bourbon, vanilla, oak, and more sweetness. Touches of dark fruit, nuts, and raisins. Touches of gentle sherry like oxidation, rich sweetness meshes with mellow barrel. Initial is fuller bodied, offering healthy sweetness, toffee and caramel mesh with touches of brown sugar, hazelnuts, toast and biscuits. Barrel and vanilla, decent kicks of spirit come into play. Middle shows sticky sweetness, gentle oxidation, and more barrel. Sticky sweet, touches of heat, and some dried fruit and more toffee. Finish is sweet and fuller, thinned out a perfect amount with dancing Bourbon heat and healthy vanilla, oak, and sticky sweet toffee and caramel, biscuits, toast, and some gentle fruit. Sweet barrel, vanilla, and nothing offensive, kisses of heat and spirit, firm and unyielding. Mellow surprisingly for the recorded ABV, a good body for its age, sufficient barrel. Its fairly complex, but not into 4D territory. Overall, solid, a bit sweet slanted. Its done very well, but for my own tastes could be a touch thinner with just a bit more barrel pushing in. Very nice though and top tier overall and I appreciate what it is, just a bit mellow for my personal top shelf examples while it does pick up the pace a bit more further in.

Bottle thanks to deyholla. Poured a beautiful deep copper with no head to mention. Aroma was simply phenomenal with caramel, toffee, vanilla, bourbon, and oak. Flavor was caramel, plum, raisin, white grape, and bourbon. Body was full and slick with no carbonation.

Bottle @ Early Winter Tasting,  Odense, 2011. Pours clear dark amber with bubbles on top. Oak, vanilla, dark fruit. Slick and vinous.Caramel and vanilla flavor. Heavy dominated by bourbon. Slick, oily and warming. A nice sipper!

2010 bottle. Red copper with a small off-white head. Big aroma of malt, caramel, dried fruit, vineous alcohol and vanilla. Sweet malty flavour, notable (but integrated) bourbon, some caramel and fruit, warming alcohol, almost a bit too boozy.

Rich clean ruby amber pour with wisps of sandstone tan head. Nose is rich and dextrinous with notes of toasted grain, spicy alcohol, sherry, and raisins with a mild sour oak character. Flavor is very rich, nice sweet oak and vanilla with lots of rich dextrinous malt character and strong alcohol showing. Full bodied with spicy alcohol.

Have had this a couple of times, latest one from a BA trader. Hazy amber brown with a smallish beige head. Aroma is lots of dark fruit and caramel, boozy bourbon, oak, toffee and light oxidization. Flavor is lots of sweet caramel malt and fruit with light tanic oak and an alcohol warming. Medium body with soft carbonation and a slightly syrupy mouth feel. This is a big, sweetish, boozy Barley Wine, very nice, probably ages very well.

2010 Bottle thanks to Jason! Pours dark brown. Small off white lacing. Nose/taste of almonds, toffee, plum, dark fruits, oak and figs. Moderate barrel presence. Sticky and sweet with some moderate well balanced warming alcohol in finish. Medium body.

UPDATED: SEP 2, 2013 12 oz. bottle shared by dbsdelight- thanks, Dan! 2006 or 2007 vintage- Dan couldnt remember. Either way, it was the older label without a year on it. 14.5% ABV. Pours a muddy amber color with no head or carbonation. Aroma of raisins, brown sugar, vanilla, toffee, caramel malts, oak, resin, and just light bourbon. Flavor of brown sugar, tea, vanilla, toffee, caramel malts, figs, raisins, and a bit of butterscotch. Pretty damn sweet. Medium-bodied, with a sweet, malty mouthfeel and low carbonation. This has held up well. The bourbon hasnt- or just wasnt big to begin with- but the other sweet notes have. Very nice.

Bottle. Cloudy amber body with a small offwhite head. Aroma is bourbon, vanilla, dark fruits, caramel. Flavor is sweet bourbon, dark fruits, vanilla, light bitterness, caramel notes. Medium carbonation.

12oz bottle  2010 vintage  courtesy of Alexsdad06  thank s Brad!  Pretty sure I have a rating in my backlog courtesy of BOLTZ7555  so thanks J as well!  Pours a murky caramel brown with a thin off-white head.  The nose is tobacco, caramel, molasses, vanilla and bourbon.  The taste is dark fruits, toffee, brown sugar, wood and bourbon.  Medium bodied.  Very tasty beer.
Rich dark fruit flavor and aroma. Figs, spicy hops. Full bodied. A bit boozy, but overall nice if a little over the top.

12 ounce bottle, 2008 vintage, courtesy of deyholla and shared at the 15th Richmond Ratebeer Gathering, 7/16/11. Pours a clear amber color with a thin head. Aroma of toffee, bourbon and a salty, cheesy note. The taste is toffee, bourbon, brown sugar, vanilla and a bitter hop finish. Full bodied with a slight bit of heat.

08 bottle.  Clear amber pour with no head.  Dark cherry, stone fruit, and carmel aromas.  Wonderful taste full of dark fruits, mild dark cherries, tons of heavy caramel malts, vanilla, oak, and smooth ass bourbon.  15% WTF??  Seriously??  Out-freakin-standing..........

Bottle shared by bhensonb. Pours caramel brown with no head at all and an alcohol and vanilla aroma. There is a complex flavor that includes vanilla, bourbon, plum, oak and a warming alcohol trail. A nice job of aging.

Thanks to jrallen34  for this great 2010 bottle. Pours dark brown with a little head. Aroma is dark caramel, tobacco, vanilla and raisin. Full bodied. Lots of vanilla flavor. Smooth dark caramel. Raisin. Mild heat. Mouth smacking.
Bottled. A hazy deep red beer with no head. The aroma has notes of alcohol, malt, caramel, and over ripe fruits. The flavor is sweet with notes of alcohol, caramel, over ripe fruits, and bourbon.

Richmond Gathering.  Deep amber, little head.  Aroma of sherry and blue cheese.  Flavor is better and more pronounced, with huge caramel malts, some dark cherry, with a boozy vanilla and bourbon finish.  Nice stuff, liked this one.

2010: Blue cheese and baklava nose, complete with walnut, dough, and honey. Hazy auburn, thin head. walnuts and honey, bready. Full body. finishes with dough. HoT, but not commensurate. Not really a hoppy barleywine, which is a disappointment. The good news is the bourbon isnt very prominent.

2008 courtesy of Dan.  Clear burgandy pour.  Bourbon barrel is obvoius on the tail.  Alcohol ammonia nose.  Reminds me of sherry.  Sweet and fruity.  Very good, but just didnt overly hit the spot for me personally.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2017 Re-rate 2017-02-19. Quite better than my earlier rating. Big strong bourbon notes. Quite a lot of oxidation. Not too bad because the style can take it but this is over the hill and slowly going down.
4oz at Mondial 2011. Rating 8,3,6,3,16;3.6

Appearance : Hazy amber with no head.

Aroma : Lots of bourbon with sweet caramel and resinous/piny hops. Nice bourbon.

Taste : Lots and lots of bourbon with resinous hops. Sweet finish with caramel, hops and lots of bourbon. Quite boozy.

Overall : Big bourbon going on. Nose is rather nice but taste was a bit too intense. I had a hard time drinking my sample completely. Very rich and complex stuff but a bit too intense. A bit too boozy also.
12oz bottle.  Pours brown with brown head. Huge toffee and hop nose. Fantastic blend of toffee and booze. Thick but drinkable.

Solid, solid drink again here. 09 vintage from a flandersned. Smooth, complex, delicious, and all the alcohol has been absorbed and turned into delicious beery goodness. Definitely a sipping beer. Ruby red brown color with no head, not surprising considering the alcohol content here. Aroma is deep plum and syrupy sweetness. A little roasty malt working in the background. As I concentrate on the flavors and aromas this beer gets more intense and complex. Also as it warms more and different flavors come out. Sort of a smoky mustiness to the aroma now. The flavor is hot but deep and malty, sweet, and chocolaty. A little bit of soy sauce at first but that leads into a smooth, complex, woody, and roasted smooth malty drink. A little syrupy and sweet but if you sip it you get your moneys worth here. You can tell i like this beer.
Bottle pours hazy orange-amber with an off-white head.  Aroma shows notes of caramel, dried fig and bourbon. Flavor shows the same with additional notes of brown sugar covered dates, agave, and oak.

2010 bottle from Jrallen, thanks! Dark brown color. Grapes, grassy hops, porto and bourbon in the aroma. Sugary sweet, alcoholic flavor with lots of bourbon and oak. Well hopped. Citrus notes. Good complexity, enough to compensate the sweetness and even the massive amounts of alcohol.

12oz bottle, 2010 edition, courtesy of ibrew2or3. thanks, dave! pours a beautiful, russet/burgandy brown with a thin, whispy, light khaki head leaving slivers of white lace. aroma is fantastic with huge notes of buttery toffee, praline candies, and light maple syrup backed by rich, intense woody bourbon, spice, and light vanilla with subtle notes of raisin, dates, and earthy hops. flavor is absolutely delicious with bold, woody, slightly smokey bourbon and light spice notes layered atop sweet toffee, molasses, and light maple with rich, slightly tart, dark fruit notes of berry, fig, and yellow raisin on the back end. palate is rich, full bodied, and lightly carbonated with an intense yet smooth, woody, bourbon finish. overall, and outstanding barrely aged barleywine.

Bottle: Poured a deep amber color ale with a very small foamy head with minimal retention and lacing. Aroma of bourbon with distinctive vanilla notes is quite powerful with some deep caramelized sugar notes and lingering sweetness. Taste is also a very interesting mix between some deep bourbon notes with some balanced vanilla and sweet malt notes. Body is quite full with medium to low carbonation and no apparent alcohol. This one is a sipper and I could not consume vast quantities at the same time.

Bottle [2010 Vintage]...  Poured golden/orange with a thin head.  Lots of vanilla and caramel sweetness with big time boozy flavors.  Creme-brulee and pastry malt sweetness.  Still very smooth, oaky, and a mild bourbon whiskey character.  Complete joy to drink.

Taste is rich, sweet and boozy with a strong maple flavor, some vanilla too. Palate is sticky  and totally mouth coating. The beer is almost completely flat, with a long, warm, alcohol finish. tasting on 3/19/11.  deep bright red pour with no head.  medium level bourbon nose with dark fruits and vanilla.  medium body - pretty sweet with dark fruits.  sweet finish with more dark fruits.  this one needs some more time.... although didnt feel like 15%.

12 oz bottle

dark amber colour, clear, no bubbles

10 bottle courtesy Sean - thank you!  Thin and quickly fading head with minimal and sparse carbonation.  Dark and somewhat transparent ruby/brown in the glass. 2010.  Thanks bulldogp04. Dark reddish-brown pour with a tan head. The aroma comes at you as you pour. Bourbon, dark fruits, malt, a little alcohol. Taste was wonderful-bourbon, dark fruit. Tasted on 1/14/11 from a 12oz bottle obtained in a trade, vintage 2009.  Pours cloudy amber with an orange tinge and a very thin white head that recedes to nothing but the thinnest of white collars. The flavor is more of the same with chocolate malted milk balls, tons of caramel, bourbon, vanilla, cinnamon, and a little more roasted than the nose would have me believe, and once again, a strong alcohol presence.  The body is full with a sticky texture, light carbonation, and a super long finish with caramel, chocolate, bourbon, vanilla, and alcohol that warms my belly.  My only complaint is that this is a little hot.  I think that it will age very well and be fantastic several years down the road.

Draft @ Blind Tiger, during the Cantillon FouFoune tapping. Dark brune pour, no head to speak of. Big sweet malty tones, dark fruit, sugar and light spice tones, aroma has a bit of the alcohol as well. Flavor is warm, not 15%, didnt know the strength til after, warm fruits, sugars, and sweet caramel and toffee malts.

12 oz. bottle, fresh Winter Solstice 2010 version, 15.1% ABV.  I wanted badly to age this beer, but years of built up anticipation and worries over Kuhnhenns well documented bottling issues forced my hand.  Pouring clear, the body is a deep crimson color, sporting a small, fading head of smooth, fine-bubbled khaki foam.  Some rounded, diagonal flares of lacing jut out from the body, clinging to the glass with moderate intensity.  The nose is deep and complex, layered with seemingly infinite waves of malty intricacies.  Chocolate roast hits first, surprisingly, lending a toasty background to an otherwise sweet blend of varied caramels, toffees, and crystallized fruits.  Baking bread and cake are evident, as are plums, raisins, dates, and toasted, maple sugar glazed nuts.  Bourbon and oaky, rich vanilla run rampant, tempered only by the enormity of the malt base.  Despite all the malty sugars, the nose still manages to come across as boozy, almost hot.  This must have been some potent barrel!  Flavors follow suit, lush and rich, malty for days and days.  Toasty toffee, burnt caramel sugars, and cocoa roast are all turned to eleven, slathered with decadent Kentucky bourbon that seems to have been reduced and just baked into the inner soul of this beer.  Raisin stew, dates, figs, and nuts are all overflowing.  Bourbon is as potent as Ive seen in any beer, yet despite its potency, it actually works in light of the massive malt bill.  Theres just enough roast in this beer to legitimize it in my book.  The palate is big and sugary, drinking downright heavy and slow, almost sludge like.  Light carbonation is appropriate.  Heavy booze dries things out a bit, but some residual stickiness remains.  Damn, this is a polarizing beer.  I hate its heft, and it goes against everything that Ive stood for over the last year, but it is well done and tasty as hell in small doses.  The best way to describe it is as a poor mans Wooden Hell.  Very similar profile, overall.  Good brew.

Draft.  Notes of bourbon, caramel, dark dried fruits, vanilla, wood and salt.  Deep reddish brown hue with an off-white head that mostly diminished and left some lace.  Flavor is heavy sweet and heavy salty.  Full bodied and oily soft.  Overall a dissappointment.  Too much bourbon and the saltiness was gross.

has a hazy red pour with some brown hues, just a few bubbles appeared on top when poured, bubbles are off-white and light tan colored, light effervescence in this beer, there was some lacing on the sides of the glass, and some light brown sediment in the bottle (this ale is not filtered),

On tap at the Kuhnhenn Brewery, 12.27.2009.

Just stopped in to pick up one of the remaining bottles of Fourth Dementia (thanks to all the BAs who pointed this out in the Great Lakes forum), and we were lucky enough to catch the 2009 version of this on tap at the brewery.

7oz pour into a mini snifter.

A: Dark caramel with some closer-to-gold hues. Bronze and a small off-white slash tan head. Moderately transparent, and somewhat of a glow. Minimal lacing.

S: The smell is immediate bourbon. Underneath the bourbon comes a malty balance including caramel, raisins, a bit of dates, hints of vanilla, toffee, and a wee bit of oak. The bourbon was definitely one of the dominant flavors, but didnt quite overpower like it does with the Perfect Storm.

T: Much like the smell, and the complexity really hits you, with each sip revealing more flavors. As the beer warms, the bourbon mellows through, and out comes a bit of malt sweetness, some nice caramelization, toffee, and a bit of woodiness. A touch of spiciness as well.

M: Quite full bodied and the alcohol doesnt come through nearly as much as would be expected from a 14% beer. Nice and chewy throughout.

D: Very, very drinkable. It was quite sad running out of this, and I would absolutely love to get my hands on a bottle to see what a few years does to this one. As it is, Im quite glad we were lucky enough to catch this one in time--props to my parents for deciding to move to MI and give my wife and I an excuse to stop by and try this one out.

Serving type: on-tap

Reviewed on: 12-27-2009
